Hi there! My team and I are having a bit of a challenge with assembling the carriage. The WCP assembly guide seems a bit confusing to us. Could you please provide a clear explanation of the assembly process? We’d really appreciate it!

Sounds like you’re on this page?

docs.wcproducts.com

String & Chain | GreyT Elevator (Cascade)

Which step number on this page are you stuck on?

Do you have a good understanding of how a cascade elevator works?

The string routes around 2 sets of pulleys on the top and bottom of the first stage. It has a fixed point that is used to tension on the carriage and a fixed point on the top of the base stage cross bar.

This means that as the first stage goes up with the chain the carriage is pulled up by the string at the same rate.

Theoreticality this could work. however, you may want to start and terminate the rope at the tensioners. The tensioners not only tension the rope but are also how the motion is transmitted to the next stage. If you start the rope at the clamping plates the only thing moving the next stage would be the few wraps of string around the tensioner. If you start the rope at the tensioner, you can tie and knot the rope around the tensioner, giving you a much more robust connection.
